channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @jh_swanson @Shmarya Maybe because the umbrella organization of American Muslim organizations doesn’t have an unrepentant Republican apparatchik as its CEO?
@rmneiss Time to update Asimov’s The Fun They Had but for the inevitable decade of poorly delivered Meta-branded VR experiences.
@rmneiss Hardly. Also delighted to see two @BenYehudaPress authors on the roster of previous podcasts.
Clearly a must listen for everyone in the Jewish ed world. https://t.co/KOKs435qfa
@scalzi At last, you’ve discovered French fusion cuisine. Bon appetite!

@froomkin @JeffBezos Radical billionaire “centrism” is an ideological choice, perhaps the only one consistent with the idea of a “non-partisan” and “non-ideological” forum of ideas.
@froomkin @JeffBezos You can’t support even Democrats like Biden, because at their core they’re partisan New Dealers, and you can’t support Republicans because they’re hateful fascists. Both sides indeed.
@trekonomics Presumably with Van Morrison and Eric Clapton.
@joshtpm In 77, Rabin stayed on as PM of his caretaker government even after bowing out of the election because of his bank account scandal. Of course, that didn’t work out well for his party.

If I remember correctly, Rabin’s first government fell in the wake of an education minister’s resignation. This led to the election of Menachem Begin.
Who despite campaigning as a Remainer was responsible for — how do you say it — Sexit.
I remembered wrong. Zevulun Hammer resigned as Welfare Minister. He became Education Minister under Begin as a reward. https://t.co/ZP7K204U9b
@ehnyay @EladNehorai It can’t afford to use high caliber reporting, because like the NYTimes and the Atlantic, it wants to appear “nonpartisan.”
@YehudisFletcher @Anzovina @cwjisrael @RStomel Ah. Britishe nachas.
@trekonomics For some. I expect President DeSantis hopes to remove that nail.
@DandiaAsad @JPoetryProject Please! The cover picture was photoshopped and does not reflect an actual Coney Island venue.

@DandiaAsad Okay, the first book of poetry @JPoetryProject published features Coney Island on one of its cover. The author has passed on, but if I wanted to hold a Jewish poetry reading there, is there a potential venue I could reach out to?
@DandiaAsad @JPoetryProject https://t.co/i2SLFi2Nek
@elivalley Hard to believe that a movement which has as a leading spokesman someone who said God demands that thoughtful non-Orthodox Jews be “hated like vermin” could fall so low.

@jh_swanson @RokhlK He’s just following in the footsteps of Mark Levin, Dennis Prager, Whatshisnane Horowitz, and Ben Shapiro. It’s a very good grift. And he will definitely outlive his fellow yidden who precede him to the ovens.
@DykeCrone @nytmike Doesn’t sound like it needs a section: Just a corrupt IRS chief and some lieutenants in the chain of command.

If the Republicans hadn’t decided to oppose the assault weapon ban, this child would not be an orphan. https://t.co/uONLNrrPpK
Maybe it’s time to question whether unapologetic Republican apparatchiks should have a place in polite Jewish society.

@LemieuxLGM Interesting. I definitely bought into this — I didn’t feel the 2000 election mattered much. Probably most of my news consumption at that point was still the NYTimes; I had let my old New Republic subscription lapse.
@LemieuxLGM It took Paul Krugman and the liberal blogosphere to radicalize me. But as Krugman repeatedly noted, his distress over Bush was rooted in reading his publicly available plans.
@YehudisFletcher @Anzovina @cwjisrael @RStomel APPG?
